results.title: Issues in education: the Victorian Certificate of Education
results.creator_credit: Victoria. Schools Division. Curriculum Branch, David Ferris, Trevor Lunn and Jeff Spencer
results.brief_description: A panel of educationalists, including two members of the Ministerial Committee for Review of Post-Compulsory Schooling, overview the new Victorian Certificate of Education and current issues in education.

results.title: Issues in education: the Chief Executive - schooling P-12
results.creator_credit: Trevor Lunn and Victoria. Schools Division. Curriculum Branch
results.brief_description: Dr. Graham Allen, Chief Executive, Ministry of Education, explains Victoria’s school curriculum plan for preparatory level to Year 12. The objective is to have the maximum number of students completing Year 12. The curriculum includes a broad education spectrum up to Year 10, with specialized subjects during Years 11-12, enabling astudents to pursue further education or to join the workforce with a knowledge of current technology.

results.creator_credit_for_label: Trevor Lunn and Victoria. Schools Division. Curriculum Branch

results.title: Israeli boy: life on a kibbutz
results.creator_credit: Encyclopaedia Britannica Films and Ruth Broyde
results.brief_description: Differing in their degree of adherence to pioneer customs, in their size, in what they produce and in the philosophy that unites each membership, the kibbutzim of Israel are greatly diverse. Here, a young Israeli boy describes life as it is on his particular kibbutz where the children are raised apart from their parents but retain close family ties. Nir explains how his kibbutz operates and tells about his family’s role on the kibbutz.

results.title: Israeli air raid on building housing international media
results.material_description: screen recording of @AJEnglish’s Twitter Digital screen recording from @AJEnglish's Twitter
results.brief_description: In the sixth consecutive day of hostilities between Israel and Hamas, Israeli airstrikes bombed a 15-storey block in the heart of Gaza that housed private homes and workplaces as well as the offices of media organisations Al Jazeera and the Associated Press. Defending the attack, Israeli officials stated that Hamas was operating an intelligence cell out in the building yet AP executive editor Sally Buzbee has called for an independent inquiry into the strike stating that this attack destroyed the ability for news reporting in the territory vehemently fighting for the world’s right to know. “This is an important story and because of the actions yesterday, the world is going to know less.”
results.title_for_label: Israeli air raid on building housing international media
results.description:
This video features in a responsive display in the museum that presents the moments, stories and memes capturing the zeitgeist by going viral on the internet.

In the sixth consecutive day of attacks between Israeli and Palestinian forces, Israel bombed a 15-storey block in Gaza City claiming that Hamas was operating an intelligence cell in the building. Along with the private homes and workplaces in the building, it housed the offices of media organisations Al Jazeera and the Associated Press who were given advance warning of the bombing. Al Jazeera broadcast live, in real time, footage of their own offices being destroyed which went viral changing the international coverage of the ongoing Israel-Palestine conflict. AP executive editor Sally Buzbee has called for an independent inquiry into the strike, stating “This is an important story and because of the actions yesterday, the world is going to know less.”
description_for_label: In the sixth consecutive day of attacks between Israeli and Palestinian forces, Israel bombed an office building in Gaza City, claiming that Hamas was operating an intelligence cell in the building. Along with private homes and workplaces, the building housed the offices of Al Jazeera and the Associated Press, who were given advance warning of the bombing. Al Jazeera and the AP broadcast live footage of their own offices being destroyed, which went viral and changed the international coverage of the conflict.

results.title: Israel: the story of the Jewish people. - Rev. ed.
results.brief_description: Vivid animation portrays Jewish history, beginning with the time of the Patriarchs, including the destruction of the temple and the great dispersion, and concluding with the Nazi persecutions. Taut documentary footage depicts the eventful and tragic years from the Zionist movement in 1900 through the birth of the Jewish nation in 1948. The film’s modern footage presents an objective and forthright description of the progress and problems of Israel today.

results.title: Israel: the 20th century miracle
results.creator_credit: R and H Media Productions and Bob Bailey Studios
results.brief_description: Illustrates how the tiny country of Israel has developed the most efficient and advanced techniques of food production in the world, under the most adverse conditions. Also highlights kibbutz and desert lifestyles.

results.title: Israel: an adventure
results.creator_credit: Nathan Kroll, Israel Government Tourist Office, Alexander Hammid and Franta G. Herman
results.brief_description: A kaleidoscopic tour of Israel where the past, present and future lie open side by side: Acre, where Jew and Arab work peacefully side by side; the modern city of Haifa with its harbour, industries and big blocks of flats; the Catacombs, Hebrew University; Jerusalem with its churches from many countries and a Yemenite wedding rehearsal. Narrated by Christopher Plummer.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Nathan Kroll, Israel Government Tourist Office, Alexander Hammid and Franta G. Herman

results.title: Israel
results.creator_credit: Walter J. Carroll, International Film Foundation and Julien Bryan
results.brief_description: The controversial history of the Jews from the time of the Patriarchs to the destruction of the Temple and the dispersion to the fourn corners of the earth. In exile the Jews kept their faith alive, through persecution and ppgrom, until the fateful events of World War II ultimately led to the re-establishment of Israel as a nation. Includes documentary footage from 1900-1948, animated footage, and concludes with a colorful spectrum of present day conditions (1965). Animation sequence designed, written and directed by Philip Stapp.

results.title: Isotopes in action
results.creator_credit: Sidney Goldsmith, ONF | NFB and Ken McCready
results.brief_description: Radioactive isotopes serve in many different ways—in preservation of food, in strengthening of plastics, in industry, medicine and agriculture. Here is a fascinating exploration, in layman’s language, of what they can do. The film shows the reactors at Canada’s Chalk River nuclear laboratories, the composition and function of cobalt 60, and developments in atomic science. (Awards: London; Buenos Aires; Rome)

results.title: Isolation technique
results.creator_credit: Willard Pictures and United States. Dept. of the Navy
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Care of the sick and injured”.
Demonstrates how to perform medical aseptic techniques when caring for a patient with a communicable disease. Shows how to set up an isolation unit; how to organise the work; when and when not to wear the isolation gown and mask; how and when to wash the hands; how to remove and clean items used in the unit. Concludes with a short summary of basic principles to be observed when caring for a patient in isolation.
